questions.question: When this is used, a variable can not be reassigned.
The context in which values are visible or can be referenced.
The combination of a function with reference to its lexical environment.
The three most common ways to handle asynchronous operations in JavaScript.
This is JavaScript's inheritance model.
The repetition of a sequence of computer instructions a specified number of times or until a condition is met.
Time required for a function to execute based on its input size.
Programming technique involving the use of a procedure, subroutine, function, or algorithm that calls itself one or more times until a specified condition is met.
In this data structure, for any given node C, if P is a parent node of C, then the key (the value) of P is greater than or equal to the key of C.
A form of automatic memory management which reclaims memory occupied by objects that are no longer in use by the program.
The most popular Node framework, allowing us to write handlers for requests with different HTTP verbs at different URL paths.
Computer program or a device that provides functionality for other programs or devices, called "clients".
A small piece of data sent from a website and stored on the user's computer by the user's web browser while the user is browsing.
A keyword in SQL that allows you to rename a column or table using an alias.
Refers to the management of incremental, reversible changes and version control for relational database schemas.
The API to a webpage, allowing programs to read and manipulate the page content, structure, and styles.
Describes all HTML elements, and includes content, padding, border and margin.
HTML5 convention via which HTML elements clearly describe their meaning to both the browser and the developer, as well as providing enhanced accessibility.
A React hook which serves the same purpose as componentDidMount, componentDidUpdate, and componentWillUnmount did in React classes, but unified into a single API.
A JavaScript API for rendering interactive 2D and 3D graphics within any compatible web browser without the use of plug-ins.
It advocates adaptive planning, evolutionary development, early delivery, and continual improvement, and it encourages rapid and flexible response to change.
A software development practice where members of a team combine their work frequently.
Design philosophy stating that rather than making users work around the product, the product should work around the user.
An approach to building new businesses based on the belief that entrepreneurs must investigate, experiment, test and iterate as they develop products.

Used to help a product manager (and others in the organization involved with the product's development) understand key traits, behaviors, goals, responsibilities, and needs of a specific type of user.
